attributes.action: Re-open the Ownhome House buying scheme to allow struggling young families a chance to get a home
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The scheme works like this -

Applicants must be

Key workers or 
First time Buyers 
and Earn Jointly less than £65,000

Ownhome loan the applicant up to 40% of the value of any open market property. This then can be used as a deposit on the property allowing the applicant to obtain competitive rates on mortgages from the linked bank The Co-operative.

The Applicant can choose when the money is to be payed back the amount of money payed back is linked to the housing market. The gorvernement take 20-40% equity stake in the house. So if the house goes up in price the government get more money back and vice versa.

The amount loaned to the applicant (20-40% of property price) also has interest payed back by the applicant so after 5 years 1.75% is payed up to 10 years where 3.5% is payed.

This scheme allows young or older families and Key worker families a chance to get on the property ladder and to help them get over the massive barrier which is the deposit which range from 15% - 40% LTV on a property. An unacheivable amount for most young people?
